tools.description: Get guidance on Azure Functions development, deployment, and Azure SDK usage.

examples.label: Secure implementation
examples.prompt: I need help implementing Azure services securely in my application using <resource> for Resource and <action> for Action.
examples.original_prompt: I need help implementing Azure services securely in my application

parameters.name: Resource
parameters.description: The type of Azure resource to get best practices for. Options include: 'general' (general Azure best practices), 'azurefunctions' (Azure Functions specific best practices), or 'static-web-app' (Azure Static Web Apps specific best practices).

parameters.name: Action
parameters.description: The action to perform. Options include: 'all' (best practices for both code generation and deployment, only for static-web-app), 'code-generation' (best practices for code generation, for general and azurefunctions), or 'deployment' (best practices for deployment, for general and azurefunctions).

operations.title: Get best practices
operations.description:
Returns best practices for secure, production-grade Azure SDK usage. Use this tool to get guidance on implementing Azure services in your applications.

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

parameters.name: Max tokens
parameters.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

parameters.name: Temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make it more deterministic.

parameters.name: Top p
parameters.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling (0.0 to 1.0). Default is 1.0 .

parameters.name: Frequency penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on their frequency (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Presence penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on presence (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Stop
parameters.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

parameters.name: Stream
parameters.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. Default is false .

parameters.name: Seed
parameters.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

parameters.name: Authentication type
parameters.description: The type of authentication to use. Options are key (default) or aad .

parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

operations.title: OpenAI: Create chat completions
operations.description:
Create chat completions using Azure OpenAI in AI Foundry. Send messages to Azure OpenAI chat models deployed in your AI Foundry resource and receive AI-generated conversational responses. Supports multi-turn conversations with message history, system instructions, and response customization.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ❌ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Simple greeting
examples.prompt: Create a chat completion with <message-array> array <deployment> using deployment <resource-name> on resource 'openai-prod' using <top-p> for Top p and <user> for User and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create a chat completion with message array '[{"role":"user","content":"Hello, how are you today?"}]' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' on resource 'openai-prod'

examples.label: With system message
examples.prompt: Create a chat completion with system message <user> and user message <deployment> using deployment <resource-name> on resource 'openai-west' using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create a chat completion with system message 'You are a helpful assistant' and user message 'Explain quantum computing' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' on resource 'openai-west'

examples.label: Control creativity
examples.prompt: Generate a chat completion for <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.8 and max 150 tokens on resource <max-tokens> using <top-p> for Top p and <resource-name> for Resource name and <message-array> for Message array and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Generate a chat completion for 'Write a creative story' using deployment 'gpt-4' with temperature 0.8 and max 150 tokens on resource 'ai-central'

examples.label: Deterministic response
examples.prompt: Create chat completion with message <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.1 <seed> seed 12345 on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create chat completion with message 'List 5 facts about Mars' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with temperature 0.1 and seed 12345 on resource 'ai-services-prod'

examples.label: Conversation with history
examples.prompt: Continue chat completion with messages: system <user>, user 'How do I create a function in Python?', assistant 'Here's how...', user 'Can you show an example?' using deployment 'gpt-4<deployment>dev-openai' using <top-p> for Top p and <resource-name> for Resource name and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Continue chat completion with messages: system 'You are a coding assistant', user 'How do I create a function in Python?', assistant 'Here's how...', user 'Can you show an example?' using deployment 'gpt-4' on resource 'dev-openai'

examples.label: With penalties for repetition
examples.prompt: Create completion for <deployment> using deployment <frequency-penalty> with <presence-penalty> penalty 0.5 and presence penalty 0.3 on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create completion for 'Describe the benefits of cloud computing' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with frequency penalty 0.5 and presence penalty 0.3 on resource 'ai-services-main'

examples.label: Streaming response
examples.prompt: Generate streaming chat completion for <deployment> using deployment <stream> with stream true on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Generate streaming chat completion for 'Explain machine learning step by step' using deployment 'gpt-4' with stream true on resource 'openai-research'

examples.label: With stop sequences
examples.prompt: Create completion for <deployment> using deployment <stop> with stop sequences [<resource-name>, 'STOP'] on resource 'ai-test' using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create completion for 'Count from 1 to 10' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with stop sequences ['5', 'STOP'] on resource 'ai-test'

examples.label: User tracking
examples.prompt: Generate completion for <deployment> using deployment <user> with user identifier <resource-name> on resource 'prod-openai' using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Generate completion for 'What is Azure AI?' using deployment 'gpt-4' with user identifier 'user-123' on resource 'prod-openai'

examples.label: Fine-tuned control
examples.prompt: Create chat completion for <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.2, top_p 0.9, <max-tokens> tokens 200, and AAD authentication on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <authentication-type> for Authentication type and <message-array> for Message array and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User.
examples.original_prompt: Create chat completion for 'Summarize this article' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with temperature 0.2, top_p 0.9, max tokens 200, and AAD authentication on resource 'secure-ai'

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure OpenAI resource.

parameters.name: Deployment
parameters.description: The name of the Azure AI Foundry model deployment.

parameters.name: Message array
parameters.description: Array of messages in the conversation (JSON format). Each message should have role and content properties.

parameters.name: Max tokens
parameters.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

parameters.name: Temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make it more deterministic.

parameters.name: Top p
parameters.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling (0.0 to 1.0). Default is 1.0 .

parameters.name: Frequency penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on their frequency (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Presence penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on presence (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Stop
parameters.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

parameters.name: Stream
parameters.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. Default is false .

parameters.name: Seed
parameters.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

parameters.name: Authentication type
parameters.description: The type of authentication to use. Options are key (default) or aad .

operations.title: OpenAI: Create embeddings

operations.title: OpenAI: Create completions
operations.description:
Create text completions using Azure OpenAI in AI Foundry. Send a prompt or question to Azure OpenAI models deployed in your AI Foundry resource and receive generated text answers. Use this when you need to create completions, get AI-generated content, generate answers to questions, or produce text completions from Azure OpenAI based on any input prompt. Supports customization with temperature and max tokens.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ❌ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Creative writing

operations.title: Speech-to-Text: Recognize
operations.description:
Recognize speech from an audio file using Azure AI Services Speech . This command takes an audio file and converts it to text using advanced speech recognition capabilities. Supported audio formats include WAV, MP3, OPUS/OGG, FLAC, ALAW, MULAW, MP4, M4A, and AAC. Compressed formats require GStreamer to be installed on the system.

Tool annotation hints :

parameters.name: Namespace
parameters.description: The name of the Event Hubs namespace. Must be used with the resource group parameter.

parameters.name: Event hub
parameters.description: The name of the Event Hub within the namespace.

parameters.name: Partition count
parameters.description: The number of partitions for the Event Hub. Must be between 1 and 32 (or higher based on namespace tier).

parameters.name: Message retention in hours
parameters.description: The message retention time in hours. Minimum is 1 hour, maximum depends on the namespace tier.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status of the Event Hub (such as Active , Disabled ). Status might be read-only in some operations.

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

parameters.name: Namespace
parameters.description: The name of the Event Hubs namespace.

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. When omitted, the system lists all namespaces in the subscription. When provided without namespace, the system lists all namespaces in the resource group. Required when getting a specific namespace.

parameters.name: Namespace
parameters.description: The name of the Event Hubs namespace to retrieve. When provided, returns detailed information for the specific namespace (requires resource group). When omitted, returns a list of namespaces.

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

parameters.name: Namespace
parameters.description: The name of the Event Hubs namespace.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The Azure region where the namespace is located (for example, eastus , westus2 ).

parameters.name: SKU name
parameters.description: The SKU name for the namespace. Valid values: Basic , Standard , Premium .

parameters.name: SKU tier
parameters.description: The SKU tier for the namespace. Valid values: Basic , Standard , Premium .

parameters.name: SKU capacity
parameters.description: The SKU capacity (throughput units) for the namespace. The valid range depends on the SKU.

parameters.name: Is auto inflate enabled
parameters.description: Enable or disable auto-inflate for the namespace.

parameters.name: Maximum throughput units
parameters.description: The maximum throughput units when auto-inflate is enabled.

parameters.name: Kafka enabled
parameters.description: Enable or disable Kafka for the namespace.

parameters.name: Zone redundant
parameters.description: Enable or disable zone redundancy for the namespace.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: Tags for the namespace in JSON format (for example, {"key1":"value1","key2":"value2"} ).

operations.title: Event Hub: Create or update Event Hub
operations.description:
Create or update an Event Hub within an Azure Event Hubs namespace. This command:

You can configure these properties:

Some properties like partition count can't be changed after creation. This is a potentially long-running operation that waits for completion.

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

parameters.name: Namespace
parameters.description: The name of the Event Hubs namespace. Must be used with the resource group parameter.

parameters.name: Event hub
parameters.description: The name of the Event Hub within the namespace.

parameters.name: Partition count
parameters.description: The number of partitions for the Event Hub. Must be between 1 and 32 (or higher based on namespace tier).

parameters.name: Message retention in hours
parameters.description: The message retention time in hours. Minimum is 1 hour, maximum depends on the namespace tier.

parameters.name: Status
parameters.description: The status of the Event Hub (such as Active , Disabled ). Status might be read-only in some operations.

operations.title: Namespace: Get namespace
operations.description:
Get Event Hubs namespaces from Azure. The behavior depends on which parameters you provide. When you retrieve a single namespace, the tool returns detailed information including SKU, settings, and metadata. When you list namespaces, the tool returns the same detailed information for all namespaces in the specified scope.

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. When omitted, the system lists all namespaces in the subscription. When provided without namespace, the system lists all namespaces in the resource group. Required when getting a specific namespace.

parameters.name: Namespace
parameters.description: The name of the Event Hubs namespace to retrieve. When provided, returns detailed information for the specific namespace (requires resource group). When omitted, returns a list of namespaces.

operations.title: Namespace: Create or update namespace
operations.description:
Create or update a namespace within the specified resource group. This tool creates a new namespace or updates an existing one. The tool might modify existing configurations and is considered destructive. This tool might take a long time.

When updating an existing namespace, provide only the properties you want to change. Unspecified properties keep their existing values. You must provide at least one update property.

Common update scenarios include:

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ✅ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ❌ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Create new namespace
examples.prompt: Create a new Event <namespace> namespace <resource-group> in resource group 'my-resource-group' in East US using <sku-name> for SKU name and <location> for Location and <sku-tier> for SKU tier and <sku-capacity> for SKU capacity and <is-auto-inflate-enabled> for Is auto inflate enabled and <maximum-throughput-units> for Maximum throughput units and <kafka-enabled> for Kafka enabled and <zone-redundant> for Zone redundant and <tags> for Tags.
examples.original_prompt: Create a new Event Hubs namespace 'production-events' in resource group 'my-resource-group' in East US

examples.label: Update namespace capacity
examples.prompt: Update my namespace <namespace> <resource-group> in resource group <sku-capacity> to increase capacity to 10 <maximum-throughput-units> units using <sku-name> for SKU name and <location> for Location and <sku-tier> for SKU tier and <is-auto-inflate-enabled> for Is auto inflate enabled and <kafka-enabled> for Kafka enabled and <zone-redundant> for Zone redundant and <tags> for Tags.
examples.original_prompt: Update my namespace 'eventhub-prod' in resource group 'my-resource-group' to increase capacity to 10 throughput units

examples.label: Enable Kafka support
examples.prompt: Enable Kafka on my Event <namespace> namespace <resource-group> in resource group 'my-resource-group' using <sku-name> for SKU name and <kafka-enabled> for Kafka enabled and <location> for Location and <sku-tier> for SKU tier and <sku-capacity> for SKU capacity and <is-auto-inflate-enabled> for Is auto inflate enabled and <maximum-throughput-units> for Maximum throughput units and <zone-redundant> for Zone redundant and <tags> for Tags.
examples.original_prompt: Enable Kafka on my Event Hubs namespace 'monitoring-hubs' in resource group 'my-resource-group'

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

parameters.name: Namespace
parameters.description: The name of the Event Hubs namespace.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The Azure region where the namespace is located (for example, eastus , westus2 ).

parameters.name: SKU name
parameters.description: The SKU name for the namespace. Valid values: Basic , Standard , Premium .

parameters.name: SKU tier
parameters.description: The SKU tier for the namespace. Valid values: Basic , Standard , Premium .

parameters.name: SKU capacity
parameters.description: The SKU capacity (throughput units) for the namespace. The valid range depends on the SKU.

parameters.name: Is auto inflate enabled
parameters.description: Enable or disable auto-inflate for the namespace.

parameters.name: Maximum throughput units
parameters.description: The maximum throughput units when auto-inflate is enabled.

parameters.name: Kafka enabled
parameters.description: Enable or disable Kafka for the namespace.

parameters.name: Zone redundant
parameters.description: Enable or disable zone redundancy for the namespace.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: Tags for the namespace in JSON format (for example, {"key1":"value1","key2":"value2"} ).

operations.description:

This command provides insights into server settings, performance parameters, security configurations, and operational characteristics essential for database administration and optimization. parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Key filter
parameters.description: Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a key of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, App* ). If omitted all keys is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label filter
parameters.description: Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a label of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, Prod* ). This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels is retrieved.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Lock
parameters.description: Whether a key-value is locked (set to read-only ) or unlocked ( read-only removed).

parameters.name: Account name
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The key name of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The value to set for the key.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to associate with the configuration key. Tags should be in the format key=value . You can specify multiple tags.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This value indicates how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Key filter
parameters.description: Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a key of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, App* ). If omitted all keys is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label filter
parameters.description: Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a label of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, Prod* ). This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels is retrieved.

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Resource type
parameters.description: The type of the Azure resource (for example, Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts ). Only provide this if needed to disambiguate between multiple resources with the same name.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours prior to now to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Event level
parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Top
parameters.description: The maximum number of activity logs to retrieve.

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

parameters.name: Webtest resource
parameters.description: The name of the Web Test resource to operate on.

parameters.name: Appinsights component
parameters.description: The resource ID of the Application Insights component to associate with the web test.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The location where the web test resource is created. This should be the same as the AppInsights component location.

parameters.name: Webtest locations
parameters.description: List of locations to run the test from (comma-separated values). Location refers to the geo-location population tag specific to Availability Tests.

parameters.name: Request URL
parameters.description: The absolute URL to test.

parameters.name: Webtest
parameters.description: The name of the test in web test resource.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the web test.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: Whether the web test is enabled.

parameters.name: Expected status code
parameters.description: Expected HTTP status code.

parameters.name: Follow redirects
parameters.description: Whether to follow redirects.

parameters.name: Frequency
parameters.description: Test frequency in seconds. Supported values 300 , 600 , 900 seconds.

parameters.name: Headers
parameters.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. Comma-separated KEY=VALUE.

parameters.name: HTTP verb
parameters.description: HTTP method (examples are: get , post ).

parameters.name: Ignore status code
parameters.description: Whether to ignore the status code validation.

parameters.name: Parse requests
parameters.description: Whether to parse dependent requests.

parameters.name: Request body
parameters.description: The body of the request.

parameters.name: Retry enabled
parameters.description: Whether retries are enabled.

parameters.name: SSL check
parameters.description: Whether to check SSL certificates.

parameters.name: SSL lifetime check
parameters.description: Number of days to check SSL certificate lifetime.

parameters.name: Timeout
parameters.description: Request timeout in seconds (max 2 minutes). Supported values: 30 , 60 , 90 , 120 seconds.

operations.title: Activity Log: List activity log
operations.description:
List activity logs for the specified Azure resource over the given prior number of hours.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Recent critical events
examples.prompt: Show activity logs for resource <resource-name> for the last <hours> hours with Critical and Error events only using <resource-type> for Resource type and <event-level> for Event level and <top> for Top.
examples.original_prompt: Show activity logs for resource 'web-app-prod' for the last 4 hours with Critical and Error events only

examples.label: Storage account activity
examples.prompt: Get activity logs for resource <resource-type> of type 'Microsoft.Storage<hours>' from the last 24 hours, limit to top <top> entries using <resource-name> for Resource name and <event-level> for Event level.
examples.original_prompt: Get activity logs for resource 'mystorageaccount' of type 'Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts' from the last 24 hours, limit to top 50 entries

examples.label: VM monitoring
examples.prompt: List all activity logs for resource <resource-name> from the past <hours> hours using <resource-type> for Resource type and <event-level> for Event level and <top> for Top.
examples.original_prompt: List all activity logs for resource 'production-vm01' from the past 12 hours

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Resource type
parameters.description: The type of the Azure resource (for example, Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts ). Only provide this if needed to disambiguate between multiple resources with the same name.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours prior to now to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Event level
parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Top
parameters.description: The maximum number of activity logs to retrieve.

operations.title: Web Tests: Create web tests
operations.description:
Create a new standard web test in Azure Monitor. Ping/Multistep web tests are deprecated and aren't supported.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ✅ | Idempotent: ❌ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ❌ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Basic web test
examples.prompt: Create web test <resource-group> in resource group <webtest-resource> for Application Insights '<appinsights-component>' in East US location, <request-url> URL <location> from locations <webtest-locations> using <ssl-check> for <ssl-lifetime-check> check and <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <enabled> for Enabled and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <headers> for Headers and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <retry-enabled> for Retry enabled and <timeout> for Timeout.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'api-health-check' in resource group 'my-resource-group' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/abc123/resourceGroups/monitoring/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/myapp-insights' in East US location, testing URL 'https://api.mycompany.com/health' from locations 'us-east-2-azr,us-west-2-azr'

examples.label: Custom frequency test
examples.prompt: Create web test <resource-group> in resource group <webtest-resource> for Application Insights '<appinsights-component>' in West Europe, testing 'https:/<location>' from <webtest-locations> locations with frequency <frequency> seconds <timeout> timeout 60 seconds using <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <request-url> for Request URL and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <enabled> for Enabled and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <headers> for Headers and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <retry-enabled> for Retry enabled and <ssl-check> for SSL check and <ssl-lifetime-check> for SSL lifetime check.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'homepage-monitor' in resource group 'my-resource-group' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/xyz789/resourceGroups/prod/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/web-insights' in West Europe, testing 'https://www.mysite.com' from 'eu-west-1-azr,eu-north-1-azr' locations with frequency 300 seconds and timeout 60 seconds

examples.label: POST request test
examples.prompt: Create web test <resource-group> in resource group <webtest-resource> for Application Insights '<appinsights-component>' in Central US, testing 'https:/<request-url>' from <http-verb> with HTTP verb <request-body>, request body <headers>, and headers 'Content-Type=application<location>' using <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <enabled> for Enabled and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <retry-enabled> for Retry enabled and <ssl-check> for SSL check and <ssl-lifetime-check> for SSL lifetime check and <timeout> for Timeout.

examples.label: SSL monitoring test
examples.prompt: Create web test <resource-group> in resource group <webtest-resource> for Application Insights '<appinsights-component>' in Australia East, testing 'https:/<enabled>' from <retry-enabled> with <ssl-check> check enabled, SSL <ssl-lifetime-check> check 30 days, and expected status code <ignore-status-code> <expected-status-code> using <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <location> for Location and <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <request-url> for Request URL and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <headers> for Headers and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <timeout> for Timeout.
examples.original_prompt: Create web test 'secure-api-check' in resource group 'my-resource-group' for Application Insights '/subscriptions/ghi789/resourceGroups/security/providers/Microsoft.Insights/components/security-insights' in Australia East, testing 'https://secure.myservice.com/api' from 'au-east-azr,au-southeast-azr' with SSL check enabled, SSL lifetime check 30 days, and expected status code 200

examples.label: Comprehensive test
examples.prompt: Create web test <resource-group> in resource group <webtest-resource> for Application Insights '<appinsights-component>' in North Europe, testing 'https:/<enabled>' from <description> with description <frequency>, frequency 900 seconds, <follow-redirects> <retry-enabled> enabled, <parse-requests> requests enabled, retry enabled, <timeout> timeout 120 seconds using <ssl-check> for <ssl-lifetime-check> check and <request-url> for Request URL and <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <request-body> for Request body and <location> for Location and <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <webtest> for Webtest and <expected-status-code> for Expected status code and <headers> for Headers and <ignore-status-code> for Ignore status code.

The Azure MCP Server can execute Kusto Query Language (KQL) queries against a Log Analytics workspace. This powerful feature allows you to analyze your operational data.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Simple query
examples.prompt: Query <query> <table> with query <workspace> in workspace <resource-group> in resource group 'monitoring-rg' for last 1 hour using <hours> for Hours and <limit> for Limit.
examples.original_prompt: Query table 'AzureDiagnostics' with query 'AzureDiagnostics | where Level == "Error" | take 100' in workspace 'app-monitoring' in resource group 'monitoring-rg' for last 1 hour

examples.label: Filter query
examples.prompt: Query <query> <table> with query <workspace> in workspace <resource-group> in resource group 'security-rg' using <hours> for Hours and <limit> for Limit.
examples.original_prompt: Query table 'SecurityEvent' with query 'SecurityEvent | where EventID == 4625 | project TimeGenerated, Account, Computer' in workspace 'security-workspace' in resource group 'security-rg'

examples.label: Complex query
examples.prompt: Query <query> <table> with query <workspace> in workspace <resource-group> in resource group 'prod-rg' for last <hours> hours using <limit> for Limit.
examples.original_prompt: Query table 'Perf' with query 'Perf | where CounterName == "% Processor Time" and Computer contains "web" | summarize avg(CounterValue) by bin(TimeGenerated, 1h)' in workspace 'monitoring-workspace' in resource group 'prod-rg' for last 24 hours

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

parameters.name: Workspace
parameters.description: The Log Analytics workspace ID or name.

parameters.name: Table
parameters.description: The name of the table to query.

parameters.name: Query
parameters.description: The KQL query to execute against the Log Analytics workspace.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours to query back from now.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: Resource ID

parameters.name: Table
parameters.description: The name of the table to query. This is the specific table within the workspace.

parameters.name: Query
parameters.description: The KQL query to execute against the Log Analytics workspace. You can use predefined queries by name such as recent which shows most recent logs ordered by TimeGenerated and errors which shows error-level logs ordered by TimeGenerated. Otherwise, provide a custom KQL query.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours to query back from now.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Resource type
parameters.description: The type of the Azure resource (for example, Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts ). Only provide this if needed to disambiguate between multiple resources with the same name.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours prior to now to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Event level
parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Top
parameters.description: The maximum number of activity logs to retrieve.

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

parameters.name: Webtest resource
parameters.description: The name of the Web Test resource to operate on.

parameters.name: Appinsights component
parameters.description: The resource ID of the Application Insights component to associate with the web test.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The location where the web test resource is created. This should be the same as the AppInsights component location.

parameters.name: Webtest locations
parameters.description: List of locations to run the test from (comma-separated values). Location refers to the geo-location population tag specific to Availability Tests.

parameters.name: Request URL
parameters.description: The absolute URL to test.

parameters.name: Webtest
parameters.description: The name of the test in web test resource.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the web test.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: Whether the web test is enabled.

parameters.name: Expected status code
parameters.description: Expected HTTP status code.

parameters.name: Follow redirects
parameters.description: Whether to follow redirects.

parameters.name: Frequency
parameters.description: Test frequency in seconds. Supported values 300 , 600 , 900 seconds.

parameters.name: Headers
parameters.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. Comma-separated KEY=VALUE.

parameters.name: HTTP verb
parameters.description: HTTP method (examples are: get , post ).

parameters.name: Ignore status code
parameters.description: Whether to ignore the status code validation.

parameters.name: Parse requests
parameters.description: Whether to parse dependent requests.

parameters.name: Request body
parameters.description: The body of the request.

parameters.name: Retry enabled
parameters.description: Whether retries are enabled.

parameters.name: SSL check
parameters.description: Whether to check SSL certificates.

parameters.name: SSL lifetime check
parameters.description: Number of days to check SSL certificate lifetime.

parameters.name: Timeout
parameters.description: Request timeout in seconds (max 2 minutes). Supported values: 30 , 60 , 90 , 120 seconds.

parameters.description: Whether to ignore the status code validation.

parameters.name: Table

operations.title: Workbooks: List workbooks
operations.description:
The Azure MCP Server lists Azure Monitor workbooks in a resource group. This helps you discover and manage your monitoring dashboards and interactive reports.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.original_prompt: Show workbooks in resource group 'my-resource-group'

examples.label: List by category
examples.prompt: List workbooks in <category> category in resource group <resource-group> using <source-id> for Source ID and <kind> for Kind.
examples.original_prompt: List workbooks in Insights category in resource group 'my-resource-group'

examples.label: List shared workbooks
examples.prompt: Show shared workbooks in resource group <resource-group> using <source-id> for Source ID and <category> for Category and <kind> for Kind.
examples.original_prompt: Show shared workbooks in resource group 'my-resource-group'

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group.

parameters.name: Category
parameters.description: The category to filter workbooks by.

parameters.name: Kind
parameters.description: The kind of workbook (such as shared , user ).

parameters.name: Source ID
parameters.description: The source resource ID to filter workbooks by.

operations.title: Workbooks: Create workbook
operations.description:
The Azure MCP Server can create a new Azure Monitor workbook. This allows you to programmatically create monitoring dashboards and interactive reports.

Destructive: ✅ | Idempotent: ❌ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ❌ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Resource type
parameters.description: The type of the Azure resource (for example, Microsoft.Storage/storageAccounts ). Only provide this if needed to disambiguate between multiple resources with the same name.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours prior to now to retrieve activity logs for.

parameters.name: Event level
parameters.description: The level of activity logs to retrieve. Valid levels are: Critical, Error, Informational, Verbose, Warning. If not provided, returns all levels.

parameters.name: Top
parameters.description: The maximum number of activity logs to retrieve.

parameters.name: Resource group
parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

parameters.name: Webtest resource
parameters.description: The name of the Web Test resource to operate on.

parameters.name: Appinsights component
parameters.description: The resource ID of the Application Insights component to associate with the web test.

parameters.name: Location
parameters.description: The location where the web test resource is created. This should be the same as the AppInsights component location.

parameters.name: Webtest locations
parameters.description: List of locations to run the test from (comma-separated values). Location refers to the geo-location population tag specific to Availability Tests.

parameters.name: Request URL
parameters.description: The absolute URL to test.

parameters.name: Webtest
parameters.description: The name of the test in web test resource.

parameters.name: Description
parameters.description: The description of the web test.

parameters.name: Enabled
parameters.description: Whether the web test is enabled.

parameters.name: Expected status code
parameters.description: Expected HTTP status code.

parameters.name: Follow redirects
parameters.description: Whether to follow redirects.

parameters.name: Frequency
parameters.description: Test frequency in seconds. Supported values 300 , 600 , 900 seconds.

parameters.name: Headers
parameters.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. Comma-separated KEY=VALUE.

parameters.name: HTTP verb
parameters.description: HTTP method (examples are: get , post ).

parameters.name: Ignore status code
parameters.description: Whether to ignore the status code validation.

parameters.name: Parse requests
parameters.description: Whether to parse dependent requests.

parameters.name: Request body
parameters.description: The body of the request.

parameters.name: Retry enabled
parameters.description: Whether retries are enabled.

parameters.name: SSL check
parameters.description: Whether to check SSL certificates.

parameters.name: SSL lifetime check
parameters.description: Number of days to check SSL certificate lifetime.

parameters.name: Timeout
parameters.description: Request timeout in seconds (max 2 minutes). Supported values: 30 , 60 , 90 , 120 seconds.

parameters.name: Resource ID

parameters.description: The name of the table to query. This is the specific table within the workspace.

parameters.name: Query
parameters.description: The KQL query to execute against the Log Analytics workspace. You can use predefined queries by name such as recent which shows most recent logs ordered by TimeGenerated and errors which shows error-level logs ordered by TimeGenerated. Otherwise, provide a custom KQL query.

parameters.description: The metric namespace.

parameters.description: The type of the resource.

parameters.name: Start time
parameters.description: The start time for the query.

parameters.name: End time
parameters.description: The end time for the query.

parameters.name: Interval

parameters.description: Whether to follow redirects.

parameters.description: HTTP headers to include in the request. Comma-separated KEY=VALUE.

parameters.description: Whether to ignore the status code validation.

parameters.description: Whether to parse dependent requests.

parameters.description: Whether to check SSL certificates.

parameters.description: Request timeout in seconds (max 2 minutes). Supported values: 30 , 60 , 90 , 120 seconds.

parameters.name: Table

parameters.name: Tracking ID
parameters.description: Filter by tracking ID to get a specific service health event.

parameters.name: Filter
parameters.description: Additional OData filter expression to apply to the service health events query.

parameters.name: Query Start Time
parameters.description: Start time for the query in ISO 8601 format (for example, 2024-01-01T00:00:00Z). Events from this time onwards will be included.

parameters.name: Query End Time
parameters.description: End time for the query in ISO 8601 format (for example, 2024-01-31T23:59:59Z). Events up to this time will be included.

operations.title: Availability status: List
operations.description:
List availability statuses for all resources in a subscription or resource group. Provides health status information for multiple Azure resources at once, including availability state, summaries, and timestamps. This information is useful for getting an overview of resource health across your infrastructure. You can filter results by resource group to narrow the scope.

Tool annotation hints :

operations.title: Service health events: List events
operations.description:
List Azure service health events for a subscription to identify ongoing or past service issues. Provides comprehensive information about service incidents, planned maintenance, advisories, and security events. Supports filtering by event type, status, tracking ID, and custom OData filters.
Equivalent to Azure Service Health API for service events.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: POST request test

examples.prompt: Create web test <resource-group> in resource group <webtest-resource> for Application Insights '<appinsights-component>' in Australia East, testing 'https:/<enabled>' from <retry-enabled> with <ssl-check> check enabled, SSL <ssl-lifetime-check> check 30 days, and expected status code <ignore-status-code> <expected-status-code> using <http-verb> for HTTP verb and <location> for Location and <webtest-locations> for Webtest locations and <request-url> for Request URL and <webtest> for Webtest and <description> for Description and <follow-redirects> for Follow redirects and <frequency> for Frequency and <headers> for Headers and <parse-requests> for Parse requests and <request-body> for Request body and <timeout> for Timeout.

operations.title: Log Analytics: Query workspace logs
operations.description:
The Azure MCP Server can execute Kusto Query Language (KQL) queries against a Log Analytics workspace. This powerful feature allows you to analyze your operational data.

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

operations.title: Log Analytics: Query resource logs

Queries diagnostic and activity logs for a specific Azure resource in a Log Analytics workspace using Kusto Query Language (KQL).

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Query recent logs
examples.prompt: Query table <table> with query <resource-id> for resource '<query>' using <hours> for Hours and <limit> for Limit.
examples.original_prompt: Query table 'AppServiceConsoleLogs' with query 'recent' for resource '/subscriptions/abc123/resourceGroups/prod/providers/Microsoft.Web/sites/myapp'

examples.label: Find errors
examples.prompt: Query table <table> with query <resource-id> for resource '<query>' in the last <hours> hours using <limit> for Limit.
examples.original_prompt: Query table 'AppServiceHTTPLogs' with query 'errors' for resource '/subscriptions/abc123/resourceGroups/prod/providers/Microsoft.Web/sites/mywebapp' in the last 4 hours

parameters.name: Resource ID
parameters.description: The Azure Resource ID to query logs. Example: /subscriptions/<YOUR-SUBSCRIPTION-ID>/resourceGroups/<YOUR-RESOURCE-GROUP>/providers/Microsoft.OperationalInsights/workspaces/<YOUR-WORKSPACE> .

parameters.name: Table
parameters.description: The name of the table to query. This is the specific table within the workspace.

parameters.name: Query
parameters.description: The KQL query to execute against the Log Analytics workspace. You can use predefined queries by name such as recent which shows most recent logs ordered by TimeGenerated and errors which shows error-level logs ordered by TimeGenerated. Otherwise, provide a custom KQL query.

parameters.name: Hours
parameters.description: The number of hours to query back from now.

parameters.name: Limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return.

parameters.name: Kafka enabled

parameters.name: Zone redundant
parameters.description: Enable or disable zone redundancy for the namespace.

parameters.name: Tags

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Key filter
parameters.description: Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a key of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, App* ). If omitted all keys is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label filter
parameters.description: Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a label of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, Prod* ). This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Lock
parameters.description: Whether a key-value is locked (set to read-only ) or unlocked ( read-only removed).

parameters.name: Account name
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The key name of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The value to set for the key.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to associate with the configuration key. Tags should be in the format key=value . You can specify multiple tags.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This value indicates how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Key filter
parameters.description: Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a key of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, App* ). If omitted all keys is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label filter
parameters.description: Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a label of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, Prod* ). This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels is retrieved.

operations.title: Key-value: Set lock on key-value
operations.description:
Sets the lock state of a key-value in an App Configuration store. This command can lock and unlock key-values.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ❌ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Lock a setting
examples.prompt: Lock <lock> the key <key> in App Configuration store 'myappconfigstore' using <account> for Account and <label> for Label and <content-type> for Content type.
examples.original_prompt: Lock the key 'AppName:ConnectionString' in App Configuration store 'myappconfigstore'.

examples.label: Lock a labeled setting
examples.prompt: Lock <lock> the key <key> with label <label> in App Configuration store 'contoso-appconfig' using <account> for Account and <content-type> for Content type.
examples.original_prompt: Lock the key 'AppName:ApiKey' with label 'production' in App Configuration store 'contoso-appconfig'.

examples.label: Unlock a setting
examples.prompt: Unlock the key <key> in App Configuration store 'myappconfigstore' using <lock> for Lock and <account> for Account and <label> for Label and <content-type> for Content type.
examples.original_prompt: Unlock the key 'AppName:ConnectionString' in App Configuration store 'myappconfigstore'.

examples.label: Unlock a labeled setting
examples.prompt: Unlock the key <key> with label <label> in App Configuration store 'contoso-appconfig' using <lock> for Lock and <account> for Account and <content-type> for Content type.
examples.original_prompt: Unlock the key 'AppName:ApiKey' with label 'production' in App Configuration store 'contoso-appconfig'.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Lock
parameters.description: Whether a key-value is locked (set to read-only ) or unlocked ( read-only removed).

operations.title: Key-value: Set key-value setting
operations.description:
Set or update a key-value setting in an App Configuration store.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ✅ | Idempotent: ✅ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ❌ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Create a setting
examples.prompt: Create a new key <key> with value <value> in my 'myappconfigstore' App Configuration store using <label> for Label and <tags> for Tags and <content-type> for Content type.
examples.original_prompt: Create a new key 'AppName:ApiUrl' with value 'https://api.example.com' in my 'myappconfigstore' App Configuration store.

examples.label: Update a setting
examples.prompt: Update the key <key> to value <value> in App Configuration store 'myappconfigstore' using <account-name> for Account name and <label> for Label and <tags> for Tags and <content-type> for Content type.
examples.original_prompt: Update the key 'AppName:MaxRetries' to value '5' in App Configuration store 'myappconfigstore'

examples.label: Create a labeled setting
examples.prompt: Set <value> with value <label> and label 'dev' in my 'contoso-appconfig' App Configuration store using <account-name> for Account name and <key> for Key and <tags> for Tags and <content-type> for Content type.
examples.original_prompt: Set 'AppName:LogLevel' with value 'Debug' and label 'dev' in my 'contoso-appconfig' App Configuration store.

examples.label: Add new config
examples.prompt: Add a new setting called <value> with URL value 'https:/<account-name>' to my 'eastus-config' using <key> for Key and <label> for Label and <tags> for Tags and <content-type> for Content type.
examples.original_prompt: Add a new setting called 'ApiEndpoint' with URL value 'https://api.contoso.com' to my 'eastus-config'

examples.label: Change existing value
examples.prompt: Set key <key> to value <value> in App Configuration store 'appconfig-prod' using <account-name> for Account name and <label> for Label and <tags> for Tags and <content-type> for Content type.
examples.original_prompt: Set key 'MaxThreads' to value '10' in App Configuration store 'appconfig-prod'

parameters.name: Account name
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The key name of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The value to set for the key.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to associate with the configuration key. Tags should be in the format key=value . You can specify multiple tags.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This value indicates how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Max tokens
parameters.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

parameters.name: Temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make it more deterministic.

parameters.name: Top p
parameters.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling (0.0 to 1.0). Default is 1.0 .

parameters.name: Frequency penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on their frequency (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Presence penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on presence (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Stop
parameters.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

parameters.name: Stream
parameters.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. Default is false .

parameters.name: Seed
parameters.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

parameters.name: Authentication type
parameters.description: The type of authentication to use. Options are key (default) or aad .

parameters.description: The name of the Azure resource group. This is a logical container for Azure resources.

operations.title: OpenAI: Create chat completions
operations.description:
Create chat completions using Azure OpenAI in AI Foundry. Send messages to Azure OpenAI chat models deployed in your AI Foundry resource and receive AI-generated conversational responses. Supports multi-turn conversations with message history, system instructions, and response customization.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ❌ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Simple greeting
examples.prompt: Create a chat completion with <message-array> array <deployment> using deployment <resource-name> on resource 'openai-prod' using <top-p> for Top p and <user> for User and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create a chat completion with message array '[{"role":"user","content":"Hello, how are you today?"}]' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' on resource 'openai-prod'

examples.label: With system message
examples.prompt: Create a chat completion with system message <user> and user message <deployment> using deployment <resource-name> on resource 'openai-west' using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create a chat completion with system message 'You are a helpful assistant' and user message 'Explain quantum computing' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' on resource 'openai-west'

examples.label: Control creativity
examples.prompt: Generate a chat completion for <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.8 and max 150 tokens on resource <max-tokens> using <top-p> for Top p and <resource-name> for Resource name and <message-array> for Message array and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Generate a chat completion for 'Write a creative story' using deployment 'gpt-4' with temperature 0.8 and max 150 tokens on resource 'ai-central'

examples.label: Deterministic response
examples.prompt: Create chat completion with message <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.1 <seed> seed 12345 on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create chat completion with message 'List 5 facts about Mars' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with temperature 0.1 and seed 12345 on resource 'ai-services-prod'

examples.label: Conversation with history
examples.prompt: Continue chat completion with messages: system <user>, user 'How do I create a function in Python?', assistant 'Here's how...', user 'Can you show an example?' using deployment 'gpt-4<deployment>dev-openai' using <top-p> for Top p and <resource-name> for Resource name and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Continue chat completion with messages: system 'You are a coding assistant', user 'How do I create a function in Python?', assistant 'Here's how...', user 'Can you show an example?' using deployment 'gpt-4' on resource 'dev-openai'

examples.label: With penalties for repetition
examples.prompt: Create completion for <deployment> using deployment <frequency-penalty> with <presence-penalty> penalty 0.5 and presence penalty 0.3 on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create completion for 'Describe the benefits of cloud computing' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with frequency penalty 0.5 and presence penalty 0.3 on resource 'ai-services-main'

examples.label: Streaming response
examples.prompt: Generate streaming chat completion for <deployment> using deployment <stream> with stream true on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Generate streaming chat completion for 'Explain machine learning step by step' using deployment 'gpt-4' with stream true on resource 'openai-research'

examples.label: With stop sequences
examples.prompt: Create completion for <deployment> using deployment <stop> with stop sequences [<resource-name>, 'STOP'] on resource 'ai-test' using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Create completion for 'Count from 1 to 10' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with stop sequences ['5', 'STOP'] on resource 'ai-test'

examples.label: User tracking
examples.prompt: Generate completion for <deployment> using deployment <user> with user identifier <resource-name> on resource 'prod-openai' using <top-p> for Top p and <message-array> for Message array and <max-tokens> for Max tokens and <temperature> for Temperature and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <authentication-type> for Authentication type.
examples.original_prompt: Generate completion for 'What is Azure AI?' using deployment 'gpt-4' with user identifier 'user-123' on resource 'prod-openai'

examples.label: Fine-tuned control
examples.prompt: Create chat completion for <deployment> using deployment <temperature> with temperature 0.2, top_p 0.9, <max-tokens> tokens 200, and AAD authentication on resource <resource-name> using <top-p> for Top p and <authentication-type> for Authentication type and <message-array> for Message array and <frequency-penalty> for Frequency penalty and <presence-penalty> for Presence penalty and <stop> for Stop and <stream> for Stream and <seed> for Seed and <user> for User.
examples.original_prompt: Create chat completion for 'Summarize this article' using deployment 'gpt-35-turbo' with temperature 0.2, top_p 0.9, max tokens 200, and AAD authentication on resource 'secure-ai'

parameters.name: Resource name
parameters.description: The name of the Azure OpenAI resource.

parameters.name: Deployment
parameters.description: The name of the Azure AI Foundry model deployment.

parameters.name: Message array
parameters.description: Array of messages in the conversation (JSON format). Each message should have role and content properties.

parameters.name: Max tokens
parameters.description: The maximum number of tokens to generate in the completion.

parameters.name: Temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the output. Lower values make it more deterministic.

parameters.name: Top p
parameters.description: Controls diversity via nucleus sampling (0.0 to 1.0). Default is 1.0 .

parameters.name: Frequency penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on their frequency (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Presence penalty
parameters.description: Penalizes new tokens based on presence (-2.0 to 2.0). Default is 0 .

parameters.name: Stop
parameters.description: Up to 4 sequences where the API will stop generating further tokens.

parameters.name: Stream
parameters.description: Whether to stream back partial progress. Default is false .

parameters.name: Seed
parameters.description: If specified, the system will make a best effort to sample deterministically.

parameters.name: User
parameters.description: Optional user identifier for tracking and abuse monitoring.

parameters.name: Authentication type
parameters.description: The type of authentication to use. Options are key (default) or aad .

operations.title: OpenAI: Create completions
operations.description:
Create text completions using Azure OpenAI in AI Foundry. Send a prompt or question to Azure OpenAI models deployed in your AI Foundry resource and receive generated text answers. Use this when you need to create completions, get AI-generated content, generate answers to questions, or produce text completions from Azure OpenAI based on any input prompt. Supports customization with temperature and max tokens.

Tool annotation hints :

Destructive: ❌ | Idempotent: ❌ | Open World: ❌ | Read Only: ✅ | Secret: ❌ | Local Required: ❌

examples.label: Creative writing

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Account
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Key filter
parameters.description: Specifies the key filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a key of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, App* ). If omitted all keys is retrieved.

parameters.name: Label filter
parameters.description: Specifies the label filter, if any, to be used when retrieving key-values. The filter can be an exact match, for example a filter of foo would get all key-values with a label of foo , or the filter can include a * character at the end of the string for wildcard searches (for example, Prod* ). This filter is case-sensitive. If omitted, all labels is retrieved.

parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store (for example, my-appconfig ).

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The name of the key to access within the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label to apply to the configuration key. Labels are used to group and organize settings.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This is used to indicate how the value should be interpreted or parsed.

parameters.name: Lock
parameters.description: Whether a key-value is locked (set to read-only ) or unlocked ( read-only removed).

parameters.name: Account name
parameters.description: The name of the App Configuration store.

parameters.name: Key
parameters.description: The key name of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Value
parameters.description: The value to set for the key.

parameters.name: Label
parameters.description: The label of the setting to set.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: The tags to associate with the configuration key. Tags should be in the format key=value . You can specify multiple tags.

parameters.name: Content type
parameters.description: The content type of the configuration value. This value indicates how the value should be interpreted or parsed.
